fields.description:
To reproduce:
 # Go to commit view
 # Click to select the first file
 # Shift-click to select the last file
 # Right click on the three dots of any selected file
 # Select discard file in the popup menu

You will be prompted with a message that says:
{code:java}
Are you sure you want to discard all your changes to the selected files?{code}
This implies that all the changes to all the selected files will be discarded but if you click OK only the first file is discarded and you are left with all the other files still selected. You then have to discard each file individually
fields.summary: Trying to discard changes to multiple files does not work

fields.description:
Presently, the combo box option that allow to choose between Tree View, Flat List (single) and Flat List (multiple) is shared between the File Status view and the History view.

Please separate them so that we can, for example, display files as a tree view in the History, while displaying files in File Status as a flat list, without having to switch the display option each time we switch the view we go in if we want to have a different display option in each view !
fields.summary: Keep Tree View / Flat List option separated for File Status and History

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Open some repositories
 * Put the repository windows on different Mission Control Spaces
 * Force Quit SourceTree (as I usually do when turning off my computer or when it crashes)
 * Reopen SourceTree

 

Expected result:
 * Each window opens on the space it was last used (Window Restoration as defined below)
 * As I'm a heavy user of Spaces, this would be a massive time saver. 

Actual result:
 * All repository windows open on the current space

 

Environment:
 * current macOS
 * SourceTree Version 4.0.2

 

Links / Further Information:

Apple provides APIs that enable Applications to restore to the desktop “Spaces” [{{https://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spaces_(software)}}] they were on prior to reboot. All official Apple applications (Terminal, Safari, and TextEdit are a few common examples) support this feature.

[https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/MOSXAppProgrammingGuide/CoreAppDesign/CoreAppDesign.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40010543-CH3-SW26] 

[https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/MOSXAppProgrammingGuide/CoreAppDesign/CoreAppDesign.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40010543-CH3-SW26] > Handling Window Restoration
fields.summary: macOS: Force Quit > Reopen Repository Windows on Spaces

fields.description:
Sourcetree keeps asking for a username and password for bitbucket.org for no reason.

Every few minutes, a popup appears asking for my credentials.
 * I use SSH for all my open repositories (I probably still have some using HTTPS, but none of them are open).
 * I don't even have any bitbucket.org repositories open
 * Under "Authentication" in the settings, I have no accounts
 * When I select New tab > Remote, there are no accounts.

I cannot find any other reason why it should think it should be trying to login to Bitbucket.

I have marked this as major because it happens every few minutes, which is absolutely infuriating.

I also cannot select the right version. I have 3.3.9 for Windows, which is what I downloaded from the website. But it says that doesn't exist. I have selected the closest version
fields.summary: Sourcetree continually asks for bitbucket.org password

fields.description: Under macOS 11.0 Beta 9, I started Sourcetree and added a repo already present locally. I was able to commit a change, pushed to the remote repo, and closed the app. The next time I started the app, the local repo was not listed in the repo list, so I added it again, committed a change, pushed to remote, and closed Sourcetree. When I started the app again, the repo was again no longer listed in the repo list.
fields.summary: Does not retain changes to the repository list

fields.description:
Sourcetree 4.0.2, macOS 10.15.6. Any attempt to view remote repositories on github gives me "Refreshing Remote Repositories Failed." Error contents are: 

The operation couldn’t be completed. (com.google.GTMOAuth2 error -1001.)

My only option is "Sign In." Clicking this takes me to github, signing in appears to work, my repositories appear to refresh, but the same message comes back. The only way to escape is to force quit the app. This happens regardless of whether I'm using ssh or https. Connection to github via command line or github desktop is working fine.
fields.summary: Refreshing remote repositories failed

fields.description:
*Етапи відтворення*:
 # Відкрити додаток Proizd.
 # Натиснути на поле "Звідки?"
 # Вибрати поле "Моє місцезнаходження".
 # Дозволити доступ до геолокації.

*Очікуваний результат*: Додаток покаже моє місцезнаходження (в даному випадку, м.Львів).
*Актуальний результат*: Додаток показує місцезнаходження "Київ-Пасажирський".
fields.summary: Додаток Proizd: невірне визначення геолокації.

fields.description:
I'm not sure it's bug or not but after recent updated I'm having issue with SourceTree. 

I have three accounts added into Source Tree: Gitlab, GitHub and Bitbucket server

Bitbucket server works totally fine but with GitHub and GitLab I have added token or password each time. It also asks me to save password to keychain which i have checked it already. 

Here is the log that I'm getting. 
{code:java}
2020-09-24 19:20:22 +0000 (e) Host returned 401 error.
 2020-09-24 19:20:22 +0000 (e) Error Message: (null)
 2020-09-24 19:20:22 +0000 (e) Checking for token validity.
 2020-09-24 19:20:22 +0000 (e) Token expired. Generating access token.
 2020-09-24 19:20:22 +0000 (e) Parameters required to generate access token are missing. Please vote on, comment on, or file a new ticket with details at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE
 2020-09-24 19:20:22 +0000 (e) mAuth instance not initialized properly 
 2020-09-24 19:20:22 +0000 (e) Missing parameter - clientID
 2020-09-24 19:20:22 +0000 (e) Access token could not be generated. Unable to retry. Please vote on, comment on, or file a new ticket with details at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE{code}
fields.summary: Source Tree asks password or token on each run

fields.description: On a maximized window, the Close button on Pull window is far on the right of the screen, while the developers tend to keep their hands close to the keyboard. It would be very productive to dismiss the Pull window also pressing the ESC key to avoid long mouse travels.
fields.summary: ESC key dismiss/close pull window

fields.description:
I created a new branch and my branch list got disappeared.I realized it could be due to some branch limit exceed, so I deleted a few branches and the list came back. I had 1580 branches. 

 

!image-2020-09-24-19-06-46-917.png!
fields.summary: Branches list hides when the branch count exceeds ~1580

fields.description: I set up Jira Project link to our Jira project on atlassian.net and I do get a hyperlink, but when I click it it tries to open the link inside the view for the commit information and just says that you have to enable Javascript
fields.summary: Jira project links not working correctly

fields.description:
macOS Catalina 10.15.6

*“Sourcetree” can’t be opened because Apple cannot check it for malicious software.*

This software needs to be updated. Contact the developer for more information.
fields.summary: Cannot install without overriding security permissions.

fields.description:
Hi Im using GitFlow.

It works perfectly locally. But if during work on my feature, it it is pushed to the origin. THen when it comes to finishing the feature, it is unable to delete the branch from the origin.

 

I login with OAuth. ANd everything works except this.
fields.summary: GitFlow Mac - Finish Feature not working

fields.description:
During a merge this comes up, but I've seen it in other hg actions. The merge won't complete.  This has been a problem for a long time and finally taking a moment to report it.  

*** failed to import extension mercurial-credential-manager from /Applications/Sourcetree.app/Contents/Resources/mercurial_local/hgext/mercurial_credential_manager.py: inconsistent use of tabs and spaces in indentation (mercurial_credential_manager.py, line 222)

 

There are indeed tabs on that line instead of spaces on the rest of the file.

 

The really annoying thing is this comes up and I'm not using the embedded mercurial. But I just figured out how to exclude that in hgrc.  Still, this tabs/spaces issue probably needs fixed.  Not sure why its not come up for anyone else yet.
fields.summary: mercurial_credential_manager.py: inconsistent use of tabs and spaces

fields.description:
I've got files in a folder starting with a '!' also using a plus sign as is very common when using Objective-C (categories).

In the current SourceTree 4.0.2 on macOS I cannot use log selected on a file path like

 

! MyEssential/NSString+JBUtils/NSString+JBUtils.mm

 

it results in a 'security issue' dialog and aborts (see attachment).
fields.summary: Can't use git log for some files

fields.description:
SourceTree is not detecting my ed25519 SSH keys when adding a profile to my GitHub accounts.  As ed25519 has been around since at least 2014, I'm leaning more toward considering this a bug than a feature request.  

My organization no longer accepts any keys except ed25519, and has removed all non ed25519 SSH keys.  This means I can no longer utilize SourceTree for code management!  Please fix. 

I've only validated this with 3.2, 3.2.1, 4.0.
fields.summary: ed25519 Support

fields.description:
My  working's VCS will not support Basic authentication (username, password). So it will be great if SourceTree supports it in next release.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Support Personal Access Token

fields.description:
# Open SourceTree.
 # Select a repository from the Repository Browser window and double-click to open.
 # Segmentation fault.

I've reset all my preferences and when I do that, things start working again for a short amount of time - that is, I can select repos from the Repository Browser and open them without issue. After about a day, maybe I cloned a new repo, did some other work in Git, I shut down the computer, come back the next day, and... this happens. I did a fresh download of the app and full uninstall/reinstall, didn't make a difference. The only way I can get it to behave again is to fully reset all the preferences and re-import all of my repositories again.

I can't think of anything specific that may have changed. Perhaps a behind-the-scenes OS patch or XCode update?

fields.description:
*Precondition:* 
 * user is not registered
 * the service is temporarily unavailable 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Launch the Railway tickets application 
 # Open My Account screen
 # Click on Create account
 # Enter E-mail,Password,Confirm password fields
 # Set Contract Offer check mark
 # Click REGISTER

*Actual result:*

Nothing happened. User is not registered. Error massage is not appeared.

*Expected result:*

User is not registered. Error massage is appeared.

*Environment:*

Samsung Galaxy Note 9, Android 10

Railway tickets application version: 1.11.3
fields.summary: Error massage is not appearing when registration is failing

On Welcome, there's a screen "Before we finish, take a moment to configure these settings" that lets me enter my name and email address.

If you enter your name and hit the tab key, it does not advance to the email address but instead selects the name.
fields.summary: Setup, Global Author tab key doesn't work

fields.description: The app regularly crashes when I close the project window after pulling from master. This happens about 1 time in 4. I assume you're seeing the crash logs!
fields.summary: App crashes after pulling

fields.description:
There was a vulnerability in Sourcetree for macOS and windows that could reveal Git user credentials via maliciously crafted URL by an attacker, This vulnerability is triggered when the affected version of Git is used to execute a git clone command on a malicious URL.

Affected versions of Atlassian Sourcetree For Mac allow remote attackers to view sensitive information via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in Git.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 4.0.2

*Fixed versions:*
 * 4.0.2

*Released Sourcetree for macOS version 4.0.1* that contains fixes for these issues and can be downloaded from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/].

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=SOURCETREEKB&title=SourceTree+Security+Advisory+2020-09-02]
fields.summary: Git submodules vulnerability in Sourcetree for Mac - CVE-2020-5260

fields.description:
Since Sourcetree 4.0 commit detail pane behavior has changed and I can't copy partial text such as commit comment, short commit id, etc by text selection. Instead of this the copy is done on whole text in the pane.

 

Version 4.0.2 (236)

MacOS 10.15.5
fields.summary: Can't copy partial text from commit

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce
 # Set the graph viewer to Current Branch
 # Rebase your current branch onto another branch using right click -> `Rebase current changes onto master` in the left sidebar
 # This modal gets super spammy and additionally blocks the FileMerge thread when I try to resolve diffs

 

!image-2020-08-11-18-48-53-065.png!
fields.summary: Silence repeated modal during rebase when viewing Current Branch

fields.description:
As of today I am getting the following error, on multiple machines in different environments. This goes for Sourcetree 4.0.1 and 4.0.2. Have not tried any other versions.

 

!image-2020-08-11-16-27-27-362.png!
fields.summary: Sourcetree for Mac won't run anymore

fields.description:
Add some sort of feedback if the selected spell checking language is actually installed.

Either make non installed language grey-out/non-selectable or give a warning/error if the selected language is not installed.

 

Currently selecting a language not installed on windows 10 gives no feedback and it's not clear that source tree uses languages from windows 10. Giving feedback if a language is not installed would improve user experience and possible saves user from creating bug reports because spell checking isn't working for them.
fields.summary: Spell check verify if language is available

fields.description:
by default I use Light Mode, at first I don't even know there's Dark Mode or Adapt Mode (Use macOS system appearance). Then, I accidentally press Use macOS system appearance and change my SourceTree to Dark Mode. When I deactivate Use macOS system appearance, and change appearance to Light Mode. SourceTree is still stuck in Dark Mode.

Please fix this.

Thank you.
fields.summary: SourceTree appearance won't change back

fields.description:
when project name or project key has 'DOC' character. Sourcetree Remote tab can not show the project's repos

 

my sourcetree version is 3.3.8.3848
fields.summary: sourcetree remote tab can't show project named DOC

fields.description:
In the section where an account can be added it says "Mit einem gehorteten Account verbinden". "gehortet" means something like pile up something.

So maybe it was just a misspelling and "gehostet" was meant. So an account that is hosted somewhere.

But I would suggest to change it in "Mit einem bestehenden Account verbinden".

"Connect with an existing account".

 

 

!image-2020-08-05-10-26-26-110.png!
fields.summary: Translation German add a new account

fields.description: Pretty straightforward and inconsequential, but it does bug me. The SourceTree logo at the top of the Repository Browser window appears very small on non-retina displays. While it almost fills the header vertically on the retina display in my MacBook Pro, it appears at less than half that relative height on my external 1440p monitor.
fields.summary: Logo scaling is inconsistent across retina & non-retina displays

fields.description: Now sourcetree for windows only has a setup exe, can you provide a portable version(.zip format) so that I can unzip it to a USB stick and use it on any computer without install it first.
fields.summary: Release a portable sourcetree for windows

fields.description:
i like to drag unindexed (new) files to staging area when in split view staging mode, and the sourcetree app just killed itself.

mac os 
sourcetree 4.0 (299)
fields.summary: drag unindexed item in split view staging mode will kill the app (mac)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Open Sourcetree 4.0.1
 # Open a Git repository
 # In the menus, choose Repository -> Repository Settings…
 # Click on any tab, except for the selected tab on the left

Expected results:
The tab is expected to open.

Actual results:
Nothing happens.

This works as expected on macOS 10.15.x, so maybe something in 11.x (currently at beta 3 as I write this) broke it.
fields.summary: Can't change tabs in Repository Settings sheet on macOS 11

fields.description:
In the list of branches, it would be nice to show if a branch is already fully merged or not, and if it is pushed to origin or not. Maybe some small icons.

This would help tremendously with cleaning old branches. Now I first have to blindly press 'delete branch', to sometimes get the message 'Branch not fully merged yet'.

Showing if a branch was pushed to origin is not such an issue, as Sourcetree will let me select the option to 'Delete remote branch', and delete the branch without issue even if it was not pushed to origin. But this flow could use some improvements.
fields.summary: Show if a branch is fully merged or not, if it's pushep to origin, etc.

fields.description:
In the history list, there is the nice view where you can see the branches, their origin, and where they were merged to.

I think it's quite hard to do, but is it possible to add a legend or something, which shows the actual names of the branches, and not just some semi-random color?
fields.summary: Add a legend for the colors of the branches in the History list

fields.description: It would be really cool if you would integrate Sourcetree more closely with Xcode (or other dev environments), so that if I doubleclick (or control-click, or even just a context menu item) a line in the diffs pans, I would immediately jump into the dev environment and the file and line with that change.
fields.summary: Open source line from diff

fields.description:
There is a 'Search' box just above the 'diffs' pane. But this search box is actually only a filter for the files list, and not a search.

If I have a big diff, I sometimes want to search for something in the diffs. But now there is no option for that.

Can you make an option to do a textual search for changes in the diffs?

It would be extremely cool if you would also add support for regular expressions in the search.
fields.summary: Search diffs.

fields.description:
When I stash my files, I often want to do that when I start to follow a path of which I am not sure. To make a safety copy (a 'save game' ;)), so to speak, so if I decide that the path is wrong, I can jump a step back quickly.

But when I stash, there is only the option 'Keep staged changes', while I want to be able to 'Keep all changes'.

So now I have to stash, and then apply again. But then I hit the issue SRCTREE-7341, which is causing me a nuisance every time.

Can you add that option?
fields.summary: Add option 'Keep all changes' when stashing.

fields.description:
Sourcetree 4.0.1

If I stash all my unstaged changes, and apply the stash again immediately, I receive the message: "error: Your local changes to the following files would be overwritten by merge:". Even though there are no local changes at this time.

Going into a console and typing 'git status' will clear the status and allow me to apply the stash again. So Sourcetree is apparently not correctly updating the git status after doing a stas, even though I don't see any files anymore in the 'File status'.
fields.summary: Stashing and restoring the stash needs manual 'git status' to work

fields.description:
I have a nice feature in mind to speed up the work and make commits faster and of better quality.

So I'm working on projects and do different edits to different files. Then I'd like to commit these changes in small isolated commits that do changes to different parts of the application. Some of it described in this article [https://about.gitlab.com/blog/2018/06/07/keeping-git-commit-history-clean/]: [https://i.imgur.com/egkbdkA.png]:

!https://i.imgur.com/egkbdkA.png!

I would like to make atomic commits in which project builds. So if I edit 2 classes and second class uses changes in class #1, but class #1 doesn't use changes in any other classes, I'd like to first commit class #1 and then class #2. Or maybe both of them at the same time if they're a part of the same part of the application.

 

The thing is that testing if project builds and works as intended only with these small changes is challenging and error prone: it requires time, many manual atomic actions and requires one to do everything exactly right and in the exact order. One bad mistake and you lost all of your uncommited changes.

 

So what can I do right now to see if everything works after I change only class1 that doesn't use changes in other classes? Suppose I have a working tree with unstaged changes. So I stage class1. Then I commit it. Then I stash everything else, as described in this answer [https://stackoverflow.com/a/34681302/6693304]:

!https://i.imgur.com/GIxWOUl.png!

 

If it builds and works, good. What if it doesn't? I have to amend commit, reset to head to it shows the staged changes from the amended commit and pop the stash. Then I add something else to the staging area, commit staged changes(class1 and some other changes I added after applying the stash). Then I stash all unstaged and untracked files again and test if it works again.

 

*That's a lot of work just to test if it builds and works*.

 

I made a sketch of how it would look like with the Stashing area in Sourcetree: 

!https://i.imgur.com/IgSwqE5.png!

Not the minus signs next to plus signs.

 

After removing files from the working tree to the stashing area(files wouldn't be in the working tree and you could test your project with only the changes in the working tree), the interface would look like this:

!https://i.imgur.com/E7EnmI4.png!
It would be as easy as moving them from unstaged to staged with {{git add}}, except the  command would be something like {{git add --stash fileName}}. 
 
It would be as easy as clicking on the minus sign in the Sourcetree, just as easy as to click on the plus sign to add to the staged area.
 
And it would be possible to do all that with hunks as well: stash hunks, unstash hunks. This isn't possible now, you can only apply the whole stash.
 
I think this would allow us to make commits of better quality and much faster than it is possible right now with all the manual work required.
 
What do you guys think?
fields.summary: Stashed area in Sourcetree

fields.description:
When adding github or Bitbucket account to SourceTree and letting source tree to generate ssh key, the generated configuration added in ~/.ssh/config have incorrect value for Host where it put name of ssh key instead of service domain e.g. {{bitbucket.org}}. It results that key have to be added to ssh agent after every reboot manually. 

Mentioned:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Permission-denied-publickey-after-restart/qaq-p/590249]

 

Current format of ssh configuration:

# --- Sourcetree Generated ---

Host *ssh_key_name*

        HostName bitbucket.org

        User user_name

        PreferredAuthentications publickey

        IdentityFile /Users/user/.ssh/ssh_key_name

        UseKeychain yes

        AddKeysToAgent yes

#----------------------------

 

working format:

# --- Sourcetree Generated ---

Host *bitbucket.org*

        HostName bitbucket.org

        User user_name

        PreferredAuthentications publickey

        IdentityFile /Users/user/.ssh/ssh_key_name

        UseKeychain yes

        AddKeysToAgent yes

#----------------------------
fields.summary: Fix Host configuration generation in ~/.ssh/config for ssh key created by sourcetree to prevent error "Permission denied (publickey)." after reboot.

fields.description: Attachment to follow.
fields.summary: Latest Sourcetree Quarantined by Corporate Overlords (Forticlient malware detection))

fields.description: When I open Terminal fro SourceTree (standard system terminal), it opens on my home directory, not project directory.
fields.summary: Terminal is not working properly

fields.description:
Hello.

When I try to open Terminal, I get an error message: "There was a problem opening this repository in iTerm2. An error occurred while trying to open iTerm2 with this repository. Please file a support ticket via the Help menu."
fields.summary: A message "There was a problem opening this repository in iTerm2"

fields.description:
I have configured external merge tool as TortoiseMerge. 

When I am connected to my working area network, the merging tool is run as it should and I can solve conflicts with TortoiseMerge.

when I am disconnnected to my working area network, TortoiseMerge is not run and the conflict can't be merged. 

 I think it is related to the path where the *.gitconfig* is saved.  
The file is saved on M:, where M: is a connected drive to my job network \\worknetwork\user\username.  
For information, here is some variables that define some path.
``` console
HOMEDRIVE=M:
HOMEPATH=\
HOMESHARE=\\worknetwork\user\username
```

I think that the bug can be fixed by setting the path where to save the .gitconfig file inside the sourcetree GUI.
fields.summary: External merge tool not launched when not connected to my working area network

fields.description:
We're trying out Bitbucket for our version control and release process and identified sourcetree has good GUI for git.

As a process, we've requested our security team to examine the tool. The feedback given by the team was sourcetree is 100% malicious.

Please provide your recommendation on the feedback of our security team
fields.summary: Source Tree Malicious

fields.description:
System used :
mac os catalina 10.15.5

 

I have many repositories from different sources:

1. azure (1 repository)

2. bitbucket (3 repositories) 

3. gitlab (25 repositories)

 

When i add more repository to my gitlab, sourcetree hides all 25 remote repositories from gitlab
fields.summary: Repositories not showing if I have more than 25 repositories from 1 source (MAC OS CATALINA 10.15.5)
Sourcetree crashes when deleting a branch starting with @

fields.description:
It would be nice if we could delete multiple local stashes at once.

Current Version: Sourcetree 4.0.1
fields.summary: Allow to select and delete multiple local stashes

fields.description: Selecting a file in the File Status Window and attempting to drag it causes Sourcetree to crash.
fields.summary: Attempting to drag file in File Status window crashes Sourcetree

fields.description:
I'm having issues copying things from Sourcetree. I noticed that regardless what the user selected last, always the commit details from the "History View" get copied when pressing Cmd+C or selecting Copy from the Edit menu.

Reproduction steps:
 # Click a commit on the history view
 # Select part of the commit message (or sha, author, date, etc)
 # Press Cmd+C or select copy from the Edit menu

Expected outcome:
The newly selected text gets placed on the clipboard

Actual outcome:
Always the commit details from the "History View" get copied
fields.summary: Selection in commit details doesn't get copied when pressing Cmd+C

fields.description: In a Mercurial project opened with Sourcetree, if I use the "Jump to: Revision/Changeset" functionality in the upper-right of the History window, and I try to enter a Mercurial revision number that is less than 1/10 of the latest revision, it will not go to the revision I want, because the revision I want is a prefix of the revision numbers that are 10 times larger. For example, if I want to jump to revision number 12345, and the latest revision is over 130000, it will stop at revision number 123459, since 12345 is a prefix of 123459. This behavior of treating the search term as a prefix makes sense for hex hashes, as a prefix can be used for convenience, but it doesn't make sense to use the search term as a prefix for chronological integer Mercurial revision numbers. I wish there can be a way to jump to Mercurial revision numbers that searches for the exact integer.
fields.summary: Sourcetree For MacSRCTREE-7317  Can't jump to Mercurial revision number less than 1/10 of latest revision

fields.description:
Cloning a repo with submodules works OK, as does pulling new tracked commits, but if an existing repo has a submodule added and this is pulled into another existing clone, a separate manual step is required.


Might need to check the .gitmodules file after a pull & run submodule init/update?
fields.summary: Pulling a new submodule in git needs to run 'git submodule init/update'

fields.description: Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahhahhahhaahhahahahahahahahahahahahahahahhahahahahahahahahahhahahahahahahhahahahahahahhahahahahhahahahahhahahahhahahahahahahhahahahahhahahahahahahahahahhahahahahahahahahahhha

fields.description:
I switched to Sourcetree recently. As a Dutch native I tried Dutch but found I had to switch to English because the localization is truly terrible. I've made myself member of the translation team at Transfer (kudos for that option) and updated the localization. Everything is now translated, except known Git terms such as push/pull/repository etc. 

The original sometimes translated those and other times it did not, leading to a Pull and a _Duwen_ button in the main window for example.

Is there a way to 'pull' the translation from Transifex into Sourcetree so I can truly test the translation updates? There were a number of places where translation outside of the app was ambiguous.
fields.summary: Dutch location update

fields.description:
I really don't like separate windows for the 3-6 repositories I normally have open. Hence I'm glad that the option to merge windows into tabs exist. Hence I'm also annoyed that Sourcetree upon every restart resets itself to using separate windows.

I'd really appreciate the option to always use tabs.
fields.summary: Always use tabs or at least respect last setting

fields.description:
I accidentally pasted a multiline block into the "new branch" field of the branch window. Since doing that, the window is large on each reopen, and it doesn't appear to be changeable (can't seem to get drag handles to move it).

!image-2020-07-06-09-57-41-035.png|width=218,height=624!
fields.summary: Branch window size broken by multiline paste

fields.description:
As you can see on the screenshot commit 235a5a3 is incorrectly positioned on the graph.

It's parent should be c0347d2.

!image-2020-07-04-11-17-29-243.png|width=495,height=334!
fields.summary: SourceTree commit graph is incorrect sometimes

fields.description: In a Mercurial project opened with Sourcetree, if I use the "Jump to: Revision/Changeset" functionality in the upper-right of the History window, and I try to enter a Mercurial revision number that is less than 1/10 of the latest revision, it will not go to the revision I want, because the revision I want is a prefix of the revision numbers that are 10 times larger. For example, if I want to jump to revision number 12345, and the latest revision is over 130000, it will stop at revision number 123459, since 12345 is a prefix of 123459. This behavior of treating the search term as a prefix makes sense for hex hashes, as a prefix can be used for convenience, but it doesn't make sense to use the search term as a prefix for chronological integer Mercurial revision numbers. I wish there can be a way to jump to Mercurial revision numbers that searches for the exact integer.
fields.summary: Can't jump to Mercurial revision number less than 1/10 of latest revision

fields.description:
I am able to selectively apply stash changes from the command line (at least at the file level) using something like this from [SO|[http://example.com].|http://example.com]./] I'd also like to be able to do this from my favorite git tool.

our project has a bunch of intelliJ files and development configurations that often need to change during development which means often stashing a collection of files that are not wanted when we later go to apply said stashes.  

anyhow, thats it thanks!
fields.summary: Add ability to selectively apply stash changes

fields.description: It's kind of confusing to have the context menu to say "add to index" and then have a panel named "staged". It's a suggestion for consistency. It could go the other way around, indexed, unindexed files as well.
fields.summary: Rename "Add to index" to "Stage" or "Stage to index" or "Add to index (stage)"

fields.description:
Scenario: I want to reset a list of flies by going to the "Workspace>File status"  and then selecting several files in the "unstaged files" panel. I then want to do "right click> reset..." so they go back to where they were. I do not want to see how they changed, I probably checked individually already. The problem is that I have to wait quite a few seconds for the line differences view to be rendered for all those files before the context menu is available. It is quite annoying.

I think that the rendering and the context menu should not happen sequentially, they are independent processes. In any case, the context menu (which should be faster) should happen before attempting to render all the files' differences.
fields.summary: Allow context menu to appear before the line diff view is rendered

fields.description:
Cannot install Sourcetree on MacOS Catalina, get a popup:

This software needs to be updated. Contact the developer for more information.

Firefox downloaded this file today at 9:46 AM from www.sourcetreeapp.com.
fields.summary: Cannot install Sourcetree on MacOS Catalina

fields.description:
If you have more than one space/desktops (to create one, go to Mission Control and create a new desktop on top of the screen) and SourceTree is placed on it, their windows won't be restored there but in first/default space instead.

It's quite frustrating for heavy users of that feature.

To reproduce:
- Create another space in Mission Control
- Open SourceTree in that space
- Go to the first/default one
- Reboot/Logout making sure that "Reopen windows when logging back in"
- After reboot/login again, observe that SourceTree is opening in the first space
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't restore its windows in proper "Space"

fields.description:
When I try to initialize git flow with a different branch name then develop, it still tries to use the branch develop.

I have a repo with a develop*ment* branch and a master branch. So I tell git flow to use development for the development branch. But it still tries to use develop.

After hitting OK in the initializing screen, it says:
{noformat}
git init -d 
Using default branch names.
Fatal: Local branch 'develop' does not exist.Which branch should be used for integration of the "next release"?
   - development
Branch name for "next release" development: [develop] 
Completed with errors, see above{noformat}
I'm on macOS 10.15.5 (Catalina) and Sourcetree 4.0.1 (234).
fields.summary: Git flow using non-default branch names doesn't work

fields.description:
Using latest version 3.2.1 (255) the details of a commit show the parent(s) of a commit, but not the children. Would it be possible to add this?

Without this feature you can only navigate backwards in history. Going forwards should be possible as well.
fields.summary: History view: also show children of a commit

fields.description: When I'm looking through hunks/lines in a changed file to stage, whenever I stage lines or a hunk, the viewfinder focus switches to the just-staged changes instead of leaving the view focus on the unstaged file that I'm looking through. Sourcetree did not used to do this for me, so I'm trying to figure out what changed and how to stop this automatic viewfinder switching whenever I stage lines or hunks. I've classified this as a major symptom severity because having to manually find and switch back to the file my view was just switched away from is an automatic doubling of work for me.
fields.summary: Staging a hunk switches view focus to staged files instead of staying on unstaged files

fields.description:
_Steps to reproduce:_

1) Select a snippet of text in the Git Commit Description panel

2) Press CMD + C

3) Go to another editor and press CMD + V

_Actual result:_

The text wasn't copied. There it was expected to be pasted from the macOS clipboard.

_The workaround:_

2) Instead of pressing CMD + C, to press the right mouse button and select "Copy" in the dropdown context menu

3) Go to another editor and press CMD + V

_Actual result:_

The selected snippet from Sourcetree app is pasted.
fields.summary: Cmd+C does not work for selected text in commit description

fields.description:
We have a multitude of Git repositories in our version control server and many have names such as "Test_foo_1", "product_foo", "foo_fighters", etc...

When I search for "foo" I never get any results, yet if I load more repos eventually I will get the one I'm looking for, just not in the search.

 

Words can't describe how broken this search capability is.  I've been using computers since 1990 and this is by far the worst search capability I've ever seen implemented.  It is case sensitive, doesn't handle wild cards, and doesnt even return results that match the repo name perfectly.
fields.summary: Search Capability is completely and utterly broken

fields.description:
Hi,

It's impossible to init GitFlow with different branch names that was earlier created by other team mate with naming:

Standart > Changed in existing repo
 * develop > development
 * feature > features
 * hotfix > fixes
fields.summary: Impossible to init GitFlow with different branch names
While Installation of sourcetree: 404 error / page not found

fields.description:
Observed with SourceTree for Mac 4.0.1 (234), if there are two branches pointing to a given commit, it seems impossible to rebase children of that commit interactively
----
*reproduction steps:*
 * Create an empty local repository
 * Commit something to create a `master` branch with an initial commit
 * Create and checkout a second branch `branch-2`
 * Commit two or more separate commits to create history on a branch
 * Create a third branch `branch-3` from `master`
 * Checkout `branch-2`
 * Right click the current `master` (aka `branch-3`) commit and choose "Rebase children...interactively"
 ** *Expected:* rebase dialog opens in order to rebase master..branch-2
 ** *Actual:* nothing happens
 * Delete `branch-3`, leaving `master` as the only branch pointing to the initial commit
 * Right click the current `master` commit and choose "Rebase children...interactively"
 ** *Expected:* rebase dialog opens
 ** *Actual:* rebase dialog opens
fields.summary: Can't "rebase children interactively" from a commit with two branch pointers

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Open a Git repository in SourceTree
2. View any diff including a moderately large file (this behavior exists in both Commit and Tree views)

Expected result:

The diff is displayed.

Actual result:

The spinning beach ball is displayed and SourceTree hangs till the process is killed.

BTW, note that I'm experiencing this on version 4.0.1 on Mac OS 10.14 (Mojave), but the "Affects version/s" field on this tracker *doesn't recognize that version!*
fields.summary: Sourcetree hangs when displaying medium-size diffs

fields.description:
Sometimes you can have a branch called

Feature_#1000_-_Eventualy_Branch_description

Trying to open this in the local git website (e.g. GitLab CE) will give you a invalid url because of the # character
fields.summary: On Merge Request, replace # with %23 if this apear in branch name

fields.description:
Hi,

Version 4.0.1 (234)

Catalina 10.15.5

I am finding that Sourcetree remains in Dark Mode even when Light Mode is selected. Light Mode is only possible when the OS is set to Light Mode, even when Sourcetree is not set to follow OS setting in the menus.
fields.summary: Light mode (appearance) not working

fields.description:
When renaming a branch the rename dialog appears. However I'm not able to set the focus to the input field using my keyboard (either using Tab or Shift-Tab)

I think we should be able to focus to the input field (or even focus the input field when the dialog is open since its the main action one would perform on this dialog.
fields.summary: Rename branch: Not able to set focus to input field using keyboard

fields.description: After setting the filter popup on top of the Log View to "Current Branch" (for example) and clicking on another branch in the sidebar, the popup resets to "All Branches". I would like the selection to stick, even across app restarts.
fields.summary: Mantain the selection of Current Branch

fields.description:
I wanted to get advantage of the automatic branch folding so i started to create features with this pattern: *feature/JIRA-1/JIRA-10*, so i could see *JIRA-1* as a folder.

 

Unfortunately it seems that now I can't close that feature anymore, I can't see the option "Finish feature", so I am forced to merge the branch manually on develop branch.

 

I am using SourceTree 4.0.1 (234) for MacOS with embededd git flow.
fields.summary: Can't close feature with '/' in branch name

fields.description:
I just installed a German Sourcetree on a Mac-Machine today and found a small mistake. During the onboarding it says:
"Bevor wir abschließen, nehm dir einen Moment um folgende Einstellungen zu setzen."

The word "nehm" does not exist in German - it's just wrong as it is an irregular verb and should say "nimm" instead.
As I was looking at that sentence I realized there is also a comma missing after "Moment".
If I would be very picky, I would even change the last verb of the sentence. As settings are not really "set" in German but rather "applied".

Minding those three improvements the sentence should either be:
"Bevor wir abschließen, nimm dir einen Moment, um folgende Einstellungen zu setzen."
or
"Bevor wir abschließen, nimm dir einen Moment, um folgende Einstellungen vorzunehmen."
fields.summary: Wrong Grammar in German onboading screens

fields.description:
In earlier versions of SourceTree for macOS I could select a commit hash (typically the abbreviated version) in the panel that describes a commit, and type cmd-C to copy it to the clipboard. I rely on that heavily for interactive rebase.

However, in version 4.0.1 that no longer works. Instead cmd-C does nothing. I have to use Copy in the contextual menu. Please fix this so the standard key accelerator works again.
fields.summary: Cmd-C no longer works to copy a hash

fields.description:
Some tag bubbles have light colour text on light colour background, making the text not easily visible.

Screenshot: [https://imgur.com/a/ss9aGvd]

I'm on v4.0.1
fields.summary: In History view, some tag colours do not allow text to be visible

fields.description:
Ever since updating to macOS 10.15.4 I've been having problems with SourceTree indirectly causing very high CPU utilization. This appears to be due to it spamming securityd with tasks, possibly some infinite loop due to the code signature verification failure, as seen this snapshot of less that 1 minute of logs: [http://it.ishe.re/6fbc8ffc8eb6]

Initially it was keeping one core at 100%. Updating to the latest version of SourceTree didn't fix the issue, so I reinstalled and that did fix the issue. However, it came back today for some reason. I've just updated to version 4.0.1 (234) and restarted SourceTree and the issue persists, although it's unclear whether it's truly persisting or if there's just an enormous queue of securityd tasks remaining to be cleared. In any case, it'd be good to not have to entirely reinstall SourceTree if whatever triggered the recurrence of this issue again recurs.
fields.summary: Spamming securityd

fields.description:
* I'm using source tree for Mac.
 * I have a Bitbucket account connected to my google account
 * I have connected my Bitbucket account in source tree (using oauth/https)
 * On Bitbucket website I click on "Checkout in source tree" button.
 * System asks "Open Sourcetree.app?"
 * I answer "Open Sourcetree.app"
 * Source tree app opens
 * Source tree shows a popup with the question "Password required For user git on host Bitbucket"

Well, obviously, I don't know the password of user "git"... 
So I cannot checkout the branch

 

 

 

BTW I run source tree version 4.01 (Mac). This version is not present in the drop down below.
fields.summary: When checking out in branch in source tree from the bitbucket website I need to provide a password for git user, which I don't have

fields.description:
Hi, 

Since the 3.3.8 version the window of git-flow feature creation changed.

The default start at branch was the development branch, but since this update it's the current branch. I searched in options and didn't find a way to configure this. Is it possible ?

If not I wonder if it could be possible to let the possibility of configuring the development branch as the default choice ? 

Thank's for your time and your work !

 

[Screenshot before 3.3.8|https://ibb.co/Q95yLdv]

[Screenshot after 3.3.8|https://ibb.co/dW2PTTj]
fields.summary: Git-flow - Default 'Start at' branch

fields.description:
SourceTree on mac goes 100% CPU all the time and makes it nearly impossible to work on a laptop. Fan speed is on max and use SourceTree on battery is not an option at all. Had my computer on a screen with power all day and when I unplugged after 9 hours my battery was 19%. 

This bug has been around for more than two years with a lot different versions. You can find other open issues in this matter with a lot of upvotes. If you Google people say the solution is to switch to another software. Seriously, What is happening??? Why don't you care about this software is totally broken on macOS? How can you ignore this bug when its forcing users to drop it?

This bug drains the life out of the computer! Give us an answer!

Look at this issue for an example: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-5306
 * over two years old
 * bug affected since version 2.7
 * over 105 affected users reported
 * 92 ppl are following this
 * and the comments...

Come on!!
fields.summary: SourceTree goes 100% CPU everytime!

fields.description:
Discovered weird UI behavior which keeps me from using it.

[See the linked image|https://pasteboard.co/J8iPPjJ.gif]
fields.summary: Weird UI behavior

fields.description: I'm using the latest version (4.0.1) of Mac SourceTree, when I try to select part of the committed message in the past, it always copy the whole message including the time but NOT just the selected part
fields.summary: Select and copy committed message always include everything

fields.description: The search view lets you find all commits by a specific author, but you lose the context of which branch that they are on.  I want to search a specific branch for commits by a specific author.  I can't seem to do that in Sourcetree at the moment.  It is possible in gitk.
fields.summary: Enable searching branch for commits from a specific author

fields.description: It'd be nice to have a mobile app for browsing code on the go/when not at a desktop.
fields.summary: Mobile App for Sourcetree Mac

fields.description:
I could reproduce this error/bug in SourceTree for a different setup (also still valid for 2.5 (104)):
 # Take an GitHub account with username *xyz*
 # Create an OAuth Authentication with username *xyz* and the same key 
 # Repeat the step above for Bitbucket also with username *xyz*

*Result:* the authentication will always fail for the second account added with the following error log:
{code:java}
2017-04-16 07:26:53 +0000 (e) Error fetching password for SourceTree (OAuth) account with username xyz.
Error Description - The specified item already exists in the keychain.
2017-04-16 07:27:04 +0000 (e) [AUTH] Error: Cannot Authorize (Bitbucket)
2017-04-16 07:27:04 +0000 (e) Fetching User owned repositories for Bitbucket cloud account failed. Error - Could not authorize request with the available token. Please re-authenticate.
2017-04-16 07:27:09 +0000 () [AUTH] beginning authentication for Bitbucket account
2017-04-16 07:27:12 +0000 (e) [AUTH] sign-in failed with error: The operation couldn’t be completed. (com.google.GTMOAuth2 error -1000.)
{code}
It seems as the key for the account is somehow related to the username, instead of the username and a unique account id.

Any comments on that?
fields.summary: Accessing GitHub and Bitbucket via OAuth with same username fails

fields.description:
I've noticed that there are a lot of cases where changes on the ripo don't show up...

In order to "refresh" I can simply open "settings" and "OK" out of it.

I've opened the debug log, and I've noticed that the command issued is "git diff". It seems that doesn't get triggered automatically, even though I have the "Refresh automatically on file change" option selected (the default).

Also it doesn't always happen on every ripo... some have this issue and some don't.

I'm on a MAC, using version 4.0.1(234)
fields.summary: Diff doesn't happen automatically

fields.description:
When dragging items found on the `File Status` view of SourceTree the app crashes.

`File Status` settings:
 * `Show only: Pending`
 * `Sort by: Path alphabetically`
 * `Tree view`
 * `Split view staging`

Steps to Repro:
 # Open any git project with SourceTree
 # Make a change to any file so that it displays as changed under `File Status` view
 # Attempt to drag the item

Expected: You might see a drag, the item be selected, or maybe nothing.

Actual: App Crashes.
fields.summary: App crashes on item drag

fields.description:
Swift Package Manager creates a Package.resolved file - similar to Podfile.lock and other mechanisms that "freeze" dependency versions. This file is supposed to be stored in source control.

It's a text file, and the diff is important - but Sourcetree doesn't know the extension so it doesn't show the diff.
fields.summary: Show Package.resolved as a text/json file

fields.description:
SourceTree for some reason allows you to select lines that are non contiguous but bafflingly it does not allow you to stage that particular selection and displays this alert. It is absolutely crazy to me to allow one but not the other, especially when other source management tools are perfectly capable of doing this.

 

!image-2020-05-01-13-40-30-868.png!
fields.summary: SourceTree should be capable of staging non-contiguous selection
Selected text is ignored and commit summary is copied instead.
